intro: Sebastiania chamaelea, commonly known as the dwarf sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and produces yellowish-orange flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive foliage. The plant is also adapted to well-drained soils and requires moderate to bright light for optimal growth.
